Class OpController<T extends ControllerProperty>

java.lang.Object
us.mn.state.dot.tms.server.comm.OpController<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Op170, OpCanoga, OpDevice, OpDinRelay, OpDR500, OpG4, OpQueryAlarm, OpQuerySamples, OpQuerySpots, OpRead, OpReadCap, OpReadIncFeed, OpReadMsgFeed, OpSS105, OpSS125, OpTdc, OpTestComm
public abstract class OpController<T extends ControllerProperty> extends Object
An operation is a sequence of phases to be performed on a field controller.
Author:
Douglas Lau, Michael Darter, Travis Swanston

  • Method Details

    • begin

      public final void begin()
      Begin the operation. The operation begins when it is queued for processing.

    • phaseOne

      protected abstract OpController<T>.Phase<T> phaseOne()
      Create the first phase of the operation. This method cannot be called in the Operation constructor, because the object may not have been fully constructed yet (subclass initialization).

    • getPriority

      public final PriorityLevel getPriority()
      Get the priority of the operation.
      Returns:
      Priority of the operation (@see PriorityLevel)

      public final void setPriority(PriorityLevel p)
      Set the priority of the operation

      Set the success flag. This will clear the error counter if true.

    • poll

      public final void poll(CommMessage<T> mess) throws IOException, DeviceContentionException
      Perform a poll with the current phase.
      Parameters:
      mess - Message to use for polling.
      Throws:
      IOException
      DeviceContentionException

      Get the error retry threshold

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Cleanup the operation. The operation gets cleaned up after processing is complete and it is removed from the queue.
